intro: Cyclocarpa stellaris, commonly known as the starfruit or carambola, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Sapotaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. The plant produces small, oval leaves and is notable for its distinctive star-shaped fruit, which is typically yellow or orange when ripe. The fruit's unique shape and sweet-tart flavor make it a popular fruit in many parts of the world. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes grown as a decorative plant.
